definition: The process of choosing one (or a small set) of preferred plans or strategies from evaluated options for execution.

positive_examples: After comparing them, we chose the staged rollout plan.
Let’s select the option with the best risk–benefit balance.
We decided to pursue the conservative strategy instead of the aggressive one.
negative_examples: This description lists the options but doesn’t pick one.
The system randomly sampled an action with no evaluation.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not generating or evaluating options; specifically committing to one or more plans as the chosen path.

exemplar_texts: We chose to proceed with Plan B.
Let’s pick the safest plan that still meets the deadline.
